content:
Psychology is a broad field that encompasses various sub-disciplines. Behavioral psychology, for instance, focuses on the study of observable behavior and its correlation with the mind. Cognitive psychology, on the other hand, delves into mental processes such as memory, perception, and problem-solving. These sub-disciplines, along with others, contribute to a comprehensive understanding of human behavior and mental processes. Which sub-discipline of psychology is primarily concerned with mental processes like memory and perception?
A. Behavioral psychology
B. Social psychology
C. Cognitive psychology
D. Developmental psychology
